Dating: BYZANTINE PERIOD (not before); COPTIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Coptic Stela
Description: This limestone Coptic stela came from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Deir Balayza at the south of Asiut and dates from the 5th-7th centuries. It is composed of a Latin cross surrounded by a wreath of greenery and by four rosettes at the corners of the stone. The main part of the stela carries an incomplete Coptic inscription mentioning the date of death of the owner.
